did.head: Collection Summary
did.abstract: Edwin Tewksbury was a rancher in Pleasant Valley, Arizona and a leader of one faction in the 1880s Pleasant Valley War. He was arrested in 1892 and charged with the murder of Tom Graham, a leader of the rival faction. Typescript of court reporters transcript of the preliminary examination of the case, Territory of Arizona, plaintiff, against Edwin Tewksbury, defendant, before H.O. Wharton, Justice of the Peace, Phoenix Precinct, Maricopa County, Arizona Territory, Aug. 29-Sept. 8, 1892.

repository.label: Repository

prefercite.head: Credit Line
prefercite.p: Transcript of Preliminary Examination (AZ 142). Special Collections, University of Arizona Libraries.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Rancher, Pleasant Valley, Ariz.; leader of one faction in the 1880s Pleasant Valley War. Arrested in 1892 and charged with the murder of Tom Graham, a leader of the rival faction.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: Typescript of court reporters transcript of the preliminary examination of the case, Territory of Arizona, plaintiff, against Edwin Tewksbury, defendant, before H.O. Wharton, Justice of the Peace, Phoenix Precinct, Maricopa County, Arizona Territory, Aug. 29-Sept. 8, 1892. Transcript by William W. Weed, Official Reporter. Also includes a name index to witness testimony.

item.corpname: Arizona. Justice Court (Phoenix Precinct, Maricopa County)
